original: Björkman, Bror Axel, stadsingenjör, Amål, f. 14/2/91 i Köpings landsförs. av insp. Axel B. o. Maria Törngren. G. 18 m. Edele Deshayes. Barn: Astrid f. 19, Bo 21, Britt-Louise 23. — Avg:ex. fr. CTL (V) 15. Lär. v. Katrineholms tekn. sk. 15-16, anst. v. Allm. Ing:byrån i Sthlm 16, posthav. ing. v. Skönviks A-B kraftstat :an-läggn. i Nedansjö 17-18, anst. v. Rib-bings Ing:byrå i Falun 18-20 o. v. stat. vattenf :verk, Trollhätte kraftverk, s. Hnjeing. v. stamlinjebyggn. 20-25, stadsing. o. byggn :chef i Amål sed. 25. Led. av Sv. tekn:fören. sed. 19. Hob-bies: jakt o. fiske.
translated: Björkman, Bror Axel, city engineer, born on February 14th, 1891 in Köpings landsförs to inspector Axel B. and Maria Törngren. Married Edele Deshayes in 1918 and had three children: Astrid born in 1919, Bo in 1921, and Britt-Louise in 1923. He graduated from CTL (V) in 1915 and worked as a teacher at Katrineholm Technical School in 1915-1916. He was employed at Allmänna Ingenjörsbyrån in Stockholm in 1916, and then as a postal engineer at Skönviks A-B power station in Nedansjö in 1917-1918. He worked at Ribbings Ingenjörsbyrå in Falun in 1918-1920 and at the state power plant, Trollhätte Kraftverk, as a senior engineer in the main transmission line construction from 1920-1925. He has been the city engineer and building manager in Amål since 1925. He has been a member of the Swedish Technical Association since 1919 and his hobbies include hunting and fishing.

worksFor.name: Trollhätte Kraftverk
worksFor.jobTitle: Senior Engineer in Main Transmission Line Construction
